channel.title: Raleigh chopper restoration
channel.description:
Way back in the day, in Manchester during my first degree... my pal Julian H and I bought choppers. Mine was rubbish, but his was a proper Raleigh Chopper MkII Quicksilver, from the late 70s. After a while I bought it off him then proceeded to ride it around Manchester in all weather, giving backies to my silly friend Steve on the way to hockey, getting attacked by manc scallies and motorists, etc. Then I rode it in Norwich for a year until, finally, the frame snapped at one of the braised joints under the stress of my >100 kg mass. No more student Chopper riding for me... My trusty steed then went into storage in my Dad’s shed for over a decade. Every now and then I would make him promise not to throw it away, as one day I would rebuild it. Now that day has finally come! The frame went gone to be sandblasted, have broken joints rebraised, and then painted fizzy yellow, along with the forks of course. Then I had some sewing, cleaning, rechroming and general fettling to do, and by late 2012 it was finished!
It’s not a show bike quality restoration - I am no pro and some bits are non standard, like the black chainguard with German Utility Yellow paint. But it’s for riding! Progress below in pictures:

item.title: Destroyed seat - my fault, it was the way I carried the D-lock.
